    • Class org.numenta.nupic.algorithms.CLAClassifier extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      1L

      • Serialized Fields

        • verbosity

          int verbosity

        • alpha

          double alpha
          The alpha used to compute running averages of the bucket duty cycles for each activation pattern bit. A lower alpha results in longer term memory.

        • actValueAlpha

          double actValueAlpha

        • learnIteration

          int learnIteration
          The bit's learning iteration. This is updated each time store() gets called on this bit.

        • recordNumMinusLearnIteration

          int recordNumMinusLearnIteration
          This contains the offset between the recordNum (provided by caller) and learnIteration (internal only, always starts at 0).

        • maxBucketIdx

          int maxBucketIdx
          This contains the value of the highest bucket index we've ever seen It is used to pre-allocate fixed size arrays that hold the weights of each bucket index during inference

        • steps

          TIntList steps
          The sequence different steps of multi-step predictions

        • patternNZHistory

          Deque<E> patternNZHistory
          History of the last _maxSteps activation patterns. We need to keep these so that we can associate the current iteration's classification with the activationPattern from N steps ago

        • activeBitHistory

          java.util.Map<K,V> activeBitHistory
          These are the bit histories. Each one is a BitHistory instance, stored in this dict, where the key is (bit, nSteps). The 'bit' is the index of the bit in the activation pattern and nSteps is the number of steps of prediction desired for that bit.

        • actualValues

          java.util.List<E> actualValues
          This keeps track of the actual value to use for each bucket index. We start with 1 bucket, no actual value so that the first infer has something to return

        • g_debugPrefix

          java.lang.String g_debugPrefix

    • Class org.numenta.nupic.algorithms.SDRClassifier extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      1L

      • Serialized Fields

        • verbosity

          int verbosity

        • alpha

          double alpha
          The alpha used to adapt the weight matrix during learning. A larger alpha results in faster adaptation to the data.

        • actValueAlpha

          double actValueAlpha
          Used to track the actual value within each bucket. A lower actValueAlpha results in longer term memory

        • learnIteration

          int learnIteration
          The bit's learning iteration. This is updated each time store() gets called on this bit.

        • recordNumMinusLearnIteration

          int recordNumMinusLearnIteration
          This contains the offset between the recordNum (provided by caller) and learnIteration (internal only, always starts at 0).

        • maxInputIdx

          int maxInputIdx
          This contains the highest value we've ever seen from the list of active cell indexes from the TM (patternNZ). It is used to pre-allocate fixed size arrays that holds the weights.

        • maxBucketIdx

          int maxBucketIdx
          This contains the value of the highest bucket index we've ever seen It is used to pre-allocate fixed size arrays that hold the weights of each bucket index during inference

        • weightMatrix

          java.util.Map<K,V> weightMatrix
          The connection weight matrix

        • steps

          TIntList steps
          The sequence different steps of multi-step predictions

        • patternNZHistory

          Deque<E> patternNZHistory
          History of the last _maxSteps activation patterns. We need to keep these so that we can associate the current iteration's classification with the activationPattern from N steps ago

        • actualValues

          java.util.List<E> actualValues
          This keeps track of the actual value to use for each bucket index. We start with 1 bucket, no actual value so that the first infer has something to return

          java.lang.String g_debugPrefix

    • Class org.numenta.nupic.encoders.Encoder extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      1L

      • Serialized Fields

        • description

          java.util.List<E> description

        • w

          int w
          The number of bits that are set to encode a single value - the "width" of the output signal

        • n

          int n
          number of bits in the representation (must be >= w)

        • halfWidth

          int halfWidth
          the half width value

        • radius

          double radius
          inputs separated by more than, or equal to this distance will have non-overlapping representations

        • resolution

          double resolution
          inputs separated by more than, or equal to this distance will have different representations

        • periodic

          boolean periodic
          If true, then the input value "wraps around" such that minval = maxval For a periodic value, the input must be strictly less than maxval, otherwise maxval is a true upper bound.

        • minVal

          double minVal
          The minimum value of the input signal.

        • maxVal

          double maxVal
          The maximum value of the input signal.

        • clipInput

          boolean clipInput
          if true, non-periodic inputs smaller than minval or greater than maxval will be clipped to minval/maxval

        • forced

          boolean forced
          if true, skip some safety checks (for compatibility reasons), default false

        • name

          java.lang.String name
          Encoder name - an optional string which will become part of the description

        • padding

          int padding

        • nInternal

          int nInternal

        • rangeInternal

          double rangeInternal

        • range

          double range

        • encLearningEnabled

          boolean encLearningEnabled

        • flattenedFieldTypeList

          java.util.Set<E> flattenedFieldTypeList

        • decoderFieldTypes

          java.util.Map<K,V> decoderFieldTypes

        • topDownMapping

          SparseObjectMatrix<T> topDownMapping
          This matrix is used for the topDownCompute. We build it the first time topDownCompute is called

        • topDownValues

          double[] topDownValues

        • bucketValues

          java.util.List<E> bucketValues

        • encoders

          java.util.LinkedHashMap<K,V> encoders

        • scalarNames

          java.util.List<E> scalarNames

    • Class org.numenta.nupic.model.Connections extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      1L

      • Serialized Fields

          double predictedSegmentDecrement

        • dutyCyclePeriod

          int dutyCyclePeriod

        • maxBoost

          double maxBoost

        • wrapAround

        • numInputs

          int numInputs

        • numColumns

          int numColumns

        • synPermMin

          double synPermMin

        • synPermMax

          double synPermMax

        • synPermTrimThreshold

          double synPermTrimThreshold

        • updatePeriod

          int updatePeriod

        • initConnectedPct

          double initConnectedPct

        • version

          double version

        • spIterationNum

          int spIterationNum

        • spIterationLearnNum

          int spIterationLearnNum

        • tmIteration

          long tmIteration

        • boostedOverlaps

          double[] boostedOverlaps

        • overlaps

          int[] overlaps

        • inputTopology

          Topology inputTopology
          Manages input neighborhood transformations

        • columnTopology

          Topology columnTopology
          Manages column neighborhood transformations

        • inputMatrix

          SparseMatrix<T> inputMatrix
          A matrix representing the shape of the input.

        • potentialPools

          FlatMatrix<T> potentialPools
          Store the set of all inputs that are within each column's potential pool. 'potentialPools' is a matrix, whose rows represent cortical columns, and whose columns represent the input bits. if potentialPools[i][j] == 1, then input bit 'j' is in column 'i's potential pool. A column can only be connected to inputs in its potential pool. The indices refer to a flattened version of both the inputs and columns. Namely, irrespective of the topology of the inputs and columns, they are treated as being a one dimensional array. Since a column is typically connected to only a subset of the inputs, many of the entries in the matrix are 0. Therefore the potentialPool matrix is stored using the SparseObjectMatrix class, to reduce memory footprint and computation time of algorithms that require iterating over the data structure.

        • tieBreaker

          double[] tieBreaker
          Initialize a tiny random tie breaker. This is used to determine winning columns where the overlaps are identical.

        • connectedCounts

          AbstractSparseBinaryMatrix connectedCounts
          Stores the number of connected synapses for each column. This is simply a sum of each row of 'connectedSynapses'. again, while this information is readily available from 'connectedSynapses', it is stored separately for efficiency purposes.

        • inhibitionRadius

          int inhibitionRadius
          The inhibition radius determines the size of a column's local neighborhood. of a column. A cortical column must overcome the overlap score of columns in its neighborhood in order to become actives. This radius is updated every learning round. It grows and shrinks with the average number of connected synapses per column.

        • overlapDutyCycles

          double[] overlapDutyCycles

        • activeDutyCycles

          double[] activeDutyCycles

        • minOverlapDutyCycles

          double[] minOverlapDutyCycles

        • minActiveDutyCycles

          double[] minActiveDutyCycles

        • boostFactors

          double[] boostFactors

        • activeCells

          java.util.Set<E> activeCells

        • winnerCells

          java.util.Set<E> winnerCells

        • predictiveCells

          java.util.Set<E> predictiveCells

        • activeSegments

          java.util.List<E> activeSegments

        • matchingSegments

          java.util.List<E> matchingSegments

        • columnDimensions

          int[] columnDimensions
          Total number of columns

        • cellsPerColumn

          int cellsPerColumn
          Total number of cells per column

        • inputDimensions

          int[] inputDimensions
          What will comprise the Layer input. Input (i.e. from encoder)

        • activationThreshold

          int activationThreshold
          If the number of active connected synapses on a segment is at least this threshold, the segment is said to be active.

        • learningRadius

          int learningRadius
          Radius around cell from which it can sample to form distal DistalDendrite connections.

        • minThreshold

          int minThreshold
          If the number of synapses active on a segment is at least this threshold, it is selected as the best matching cell in a bursting column.

        • maxNewSynapseCount

          int maxNewSynapseCount
          The maximum number of synapses added to a segment during learning.

        • maxSegmentsPerCell

          int maxSegmentsPerCell
          The maximum number of segments (distal dendrites) allowed on a cell

        • maxSynapsesPerSegment

          int maxSynapsesPerSegment
          The maximum number of synapses allowed on a given segment (distal dendrite)

        • initialPermanence

          double initialPermanence
          Initial permanence of a new synapse

        • connectedPermanence

          double connectedPermanence
          If the permanence value for a synapse is greater than this value, it is said to be connected.

        • permanenceIncrement

          double permanenceIncrement
          Amount by which permanences of synapses are incremented during learning.

        • permanenceDecrement

          double permanenceDecrement
          Amount by which permanences of synapses are decremented during learning.

        • memory

          SparseObjectMatrix<T> memory
          The main data structure containing columns, cells, and synapses

        • cells

          Cell[] cells

        • receptorSynapses

          java.util.Map<K,V> receptorSynapses
          Reverse mapping from source cell to Synapse

        • segments

          java.util.Map<K,V> segments

        • distalSynapses

          java.util.Map<K,V> distalSynapses

        • proximalSynapses

          java.util.Map<K,V> proximalSynapses

        • proximalSynapseCounter

          int proximalSynapseCounter
          Helps index each new proximal Synapse

        • nextFlatIdx

          int nextFlatIdx
          Global tracker of the next available segment index

        • nextSegmentOrdinal

          int nextSegmentOrdinal
          Global counter incremented for each DD segment creation

        • nextSynapseOrdinal

          int nextSynapseOrdinal
          Global counter incremented for each DD synapse creation

        • numSynapses

          long numSynapses
          Total number of synapses

        • freeFlatIdxs

          TIntArrayList freeFlatIdxs
          Used for recycling DistalDendrite indexes

        • segmentForFlatIdx

          java.util.List<E> segmentForFlatIdx
          Indexed segments by their global index (can contain nulls)

        • lastActivity

          Connections.Activity lastActivity
          Stores each cycle's most recent activity

        • seed

          int seed
          The default random number seed

        • random

          java.util.Random random
          The random number generator

        • segmentPositionSortKey

          java.util.Comparator<T> segmentPositionSortKey
          Sorting Lambda used for sorting active and matching segments

        • inhibitionComparator

          java.util.Comparator<T> inhibitionComparator
          Sorting Lambda used for SpatialPooler inhibition
